body.p: A broadcaster is used when you want multiple elements to share one or more attribute values, or when you want elements to respond to a state change. Any elements that are observing the broadcaster will share the attributes placed on the broadcaster. For instance, if the broadcaster has a template.XULAttr("label") attribute, the observers will use that label. If the label changes, the labels of the observers will update automatically. An onbroadcast event will be sent to the observers when a change is made.

For template.XULElem("menuitem")s or template.XULElem("button")s that just want to have their template.XULAttr("disabled") status set when the feature should be disabled, you should use a template.XULElem("command") element instead.
More information is available in the Broadcasters and Observers XUL Tutorial.
